category: Articles of Incorporation/Article 37 (Request for dismissal, etc.)
contents: Article 37 (Request for dismissal, etc.) ① If the Board of Directors determines that the Chairman has a significant impediment to the performance of his duties as Chairman, such as by violating laws or the Articles of Incorporation or neglecting his duties, he may be dismissed by the Minister of Health and Welfare after a resolution by the Board of Directors. You may be asked to make suggestions. Revised on June 23, 2009, March 30, 2010, ② If deemed necessary, a non-executive director may, with the joint signature of two or more non-executive directors, request an auditor to audit a specific matter related to the operation of the Corporation, and the auditor may do so. must follow this unless there are special circumstances. However, if there are special circumstances that make it difficult to comply with the audit request, the reason must be disclosed to the relevant non-executive director and the fact must be reported to the board of directors. Revised January 5, 2022, ③ Non-executive directors may request the Chairman of the Board of Directors to provide materials necessary for performing duties, and the Chairman of the Board of Directors shall comply therewith unless there are special reasons. However, if there are special circumstances that make it difficult to comply with a request for data, the reason must be disclosed to the relevant non-executive director and the fact must be reported to the board of directors. Revised 2022. 1. 5.
